page.title: 07THE VILLAGE (cont.)
page.content:
aid the less agile worshippers of the past to mount their horses, their wives behind them. In the church is kept a plaster-cast of the early Celtic cross found in the manse garden; the original now held in the National Museum of Antiquities, Edinburgh. The church is to become a "linked charge" with Gullane church in late 1985.
Also situated at the western end of the village, on the southern side of the main road, is the school which caters for primary pupils aged from 4+ to 12. The present school building was opened in 1931 and was built as a replacement for the then grossly over- crowded premises which were located on land now occupied by an extension to the Kilspindie Hotel. In July 1985 the school roll stood at 66 pupils.
